snippet: NASA’s test run of a Mars landing system came to a quick end on Monday when the saucer-shaped vehicle’s parachute tore away after partly unfurling high over the Pacific Ocean, a NASA TV broadcast showed.
abstract: Test run of NASA's Mars landing system ends in failure after vehicle's parachute malfunctions during descent over Pacific Ocean; system, known as the Low Density Supersonic Decelerator, also failed during debut test in 2014.
lead_paragraph: NASA’s test run of a Mars landing system came to a quick end on Monday when the saucer-shaped vehicle’s parachute tore away after partly unfurling high over the Pacific Ocean, a NASA TV broadcast showed.
